programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ashton and Young's engagement party proves eventful as Stamp tries to muscle in on Ackland and Carver's secret relationship and Gold realises Gilmore is still pining for the bridegroom-to-be. Meanwhile, tensions run high on the streets of Sun Hill after a newly arrived prostitute demonstrates a propensity for robbing her clients

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rival drug dealers look set to start a full-scale gang war on the Bronte Estate, leaving Sun Hill officers desperately awaiting the arrival of their new Superintendent to regain control of the trouble spot. Hunter's community involvement seems to have a sinister motive and Stamp apologises for making advances to Ackland at the engagement party, while Rickman gives journalist Simon Kitson a piece of her mind

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As gang warfare threatens to engulf the Bronte estate, Hunter seems to be pursuing his own agenda, manipulating the rival factions and using Klein as a pawn in his game. With events rapidly spinning out of control, Meadows seems paralysed by indecision and realises his career may come to an inglorious end as efficient new officer Adam Okaro arrives on the scene and wastes no time in restoring order

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack Meadows starts making retirement plans as yet another new broom sweeps into Sun Hill and it's clear Superintendent Adam Okaro has been doing his homework as he carpets Hunter straight away for his shady dealings on the Bronte Estate, promptly declaring the ghetto a no-go area for his officers. Gold makes the new boss more than welcome, and Klein's drug habit begins to interfere with his work. Cyril Nri stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Feature-length drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the 20th century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist - a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta-Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the drama. A couple wake up to find a strangled corpse on the hearthrug in their library - but help is at hand in the diminutive form of venerable amateur sleuth Miss Marple, who just happens to live next door. She agrees to investigate but, as her inquiries get under way, another body is discovered. Joan Hickson, Gwen Watford and Moray Watson star

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: A First World War veteran is entrusted with the task of publishing his friend's controversial memoirs - but his body turns up on a river bank. One chapter of the document is missing - and it is up to the detectives to find out what it contained. Patrick Malahide, Frederick Treves and Frances Barber star

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: In the wake of recent events, Alex is forced to finally admit the truth. The peace negotiations between Semiyon and his enemies in Istanbul get underway, and seem to bring matters to a close - but not before Alex suffers a further betrayal. Vadim is left feeling conflicted by the violence he is forced to live with and his love for his daughter

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The maverick detective returns to work after a traumatic arrest to investigate the murder of a former child genius's parents, and quickly deduces that their daughter is responsible. However, unable to find evidence to convict, he becomes embroiled in a battle of wits with the suspect - who has set her sights on him and his estranged wife. Idris Elba stars in the first instalment of the acclaimed detective drama, with Indira Varma, Steven Mackintosh, Saskia Reeves, Paul McGann and Ruth Wilson

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: The search for kidnapped woman Ann Gallagher takes an unexpected turn when Kirsten pulls a van over for speeding, only to hear muffled sounds coming from the back. However, when she asks the driver to open the door, things turn nasty and she is forced to radio for help. Catherine can't shake the feeling that Tommy is near and returns to the deserted house. Against police protocol she breaks in - and instantly realises something sinister has happened. Sarah Lancashire stars in the dark drama written by Sally Wainwright

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman

programme.desc: Laura threatens to jump ship when offered a job at a large centre in London. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Julia St John

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include a medal given to one of the first men to land on D-Day, a dress by Swinging Sixties fashion designer Ossie Clark, and one of the first vials of penicillin. Fiona also meets the son of a Chinese immigrant and ship worker to discuss the history of the Chinese community in Liverpool

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Steven Knight's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an orphan pursuing his desire for a greater lot in life. His life is changed forever first by an encounter with an escaped convict, and then again when he is summoned to the household of wealthy recluse Miss Havisham (Olivia Colman), who intends him to be the companion of her adopted daughter

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Including highlights of Manchester City v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Manchester United v West Ham United and Everton v Liverpool

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint left behind at an old break-in solves a murder at the same factory months later. A DNA spray means police can finally apprehend a prolific motorbike thief

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble return to Longleat, where a lion needs surgery to amputate part of its tail. Kate gets a surprise with the babies in the large herd of eland

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a two-bed terrace in Erith, Kent that only has a short lease. He also visits a terrace in Derby, while Tommy Walsh is in London at a top-floor flat with a charming view

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Oswestry in Shropshire, and challenges fair-goers to guess the purpose of a food-related mystery item. With experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen discovers the wonders of talking texts and Rich uses Ollie to spend time with Kirsty. Bear's roped into wearing an interesting costume to raise money for charity, but has to give chase in it when a thief makes off with the donation box

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea shows a crafty make to hang bathroom towels on, while Jay Blades builds an under-bed storage solution. Plus, Monty Don gives us the lowdown on the best hedge trimming tools, a dated armchair is given an outrageous upcycle, and Alan Titchmarsh shares his secrets on how to build a pond

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from the largest town in Dorset to move to rural Devon, and learns the importance of local newspapers in keeping communities connected and informed

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson go looking for bargains in Wales, discovering Llanelli's boxing history and the story behind some traditional local dishes along the way

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four family members competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben steps in last minute to impress Phil at the grand opening of the Boxing Den and Lola gets a call from the hospital. Linda frets as she waits for Janine's plea and Rocky worries that his past will catch up with him as he and Kathy meet the Vicar to discuss their upcoming nuptials

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Millions of council houses were built after the war to help protect people from slum landlords. They used to be home to around a third of the UK population. Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Working with ethical hackers to hack into the fraudsters' illegal call centres, Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor the scammers' phone calls in an effort to stop victims losing out to real-time scams. The programme also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods, such as bike theft, fly-tipping and romance scams, and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head-on

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Drama following three new recruits to Belfast's police force. Probationer Grace tries to help a fellow single mother whose son has fallen in with a notorious gang. However, fulfilling her promise could put her at risk from both sides of the law. Her fellow new recruits Annie and Tommy deal with an apprehensive colleague and undercover agents at work in the city, while their superior officer finds himself being threatened by MI5. Starring Sian Brooke

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: Ten of the UK's most promising unsigned artists head to Manchester to attempt to convince global singer-songwriter Jason Derulo, music manager Frank Harris and Brit Award winner Becky Hill that they have everything it takes to cut through in today's music industry. Host Jordan North captures all the backstage drama as the contenders vie for a life-changing record deal

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Ex-Geordie Shore reality star Charlotte Crosby showcases her home town of Sunderland, life with her family and partner Jake and her extraordinary social life. She also outlines the progress of her growing business empire but when she receives some life changing news, how will she respond?

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: After an emotional scan, Charlotte announces her pregnancy to the world and her best friend Lauren is called in to help with a grand plan to take over York Fashion Week. Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The finalists take on their last challenge to win a £250,000 investment, with contestants ejected earlier in the series returning to aid them in their endeavours. The last two must launch their business, create a new brand for their company, produce a digital billboard, direct and edit a television advertisement and design a metaverse, before pitching to Lord Sugar and industry experts at a black-tie event

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen meets the 2023 winner and runner-up, and is joined by special guests - including Lord Sugar via videolink - to look back over the past 12 weeks of the business-based reality show

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Police find the names of an international drug network in a hotel guest book plus thieves who stole £20,000 worth of food are caught out by a car number plate

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It's a worrying time when one of the pygmy goats goes into labour unexpectedly. Ben Fogle helps the keepers sex their young pancake tortoises

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a semi-detached house just outside Dudley in the West Midlands and a mid-terrace in Burton-upon-Trent that has suffered some fire damage. Dion Dublin is in Bury, Greater Manchester, to see a house that needs a good clear-out

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and David Harper help two teams scour Edinburgh's Royal Highland Centre to pick up items to sell at auction, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp hears about an ice-cream van that's been doing the rounds since 1936

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Luca and Suni try to iron things out. Ollie tries to help his dad but Rich has an unwanted request. Emma has to placate an irate mother when she finds out her daughter wants a baby

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea make clothes rails out of timber and copper piping, while archive clips include Danny Clarke reshaping a garden by carving out eyecatching flower beds

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a buyer with a budget of £450,000 escape her ex-council flat in south London so her and her daughter can start a new life in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson tour Wales, picking up a rare toby jug and some art deco items. They also learn about an ancient fishing tradition and a Welsh Olympic legend

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Ben, Theo, Tobias and Niamh try to find the right path across the bridge in the hope of winning some cash. Game show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia gives Rocky an ultimatum, either he tells Kathy his secret by the end of the day, or she will. Lola is determined to plan a successful fundraiser and Keanu declares his love for a conflicted Sharon. Sam and Alfie drown their sorrows over their failed love lives at The Vic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Meet Joe Black (1998)
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty Don gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Cambridgeshire and reveals how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. And Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Dorset

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Nick Hewer, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Scarlett Moffatt, Monty Panesar, Louisa Clein and Shazia Mirza are on their final day in Derry Londonderry, when the delayed seventh participant arrives. Jetting in from the Paralympics in Japan, table tennis star Will Bayley completes the pilgrim band. Eventually they leave Northern Ireland behind them and set sail across the North Channel to western Scotland and join the Kintyre Way

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: At mainland Wales' most northerly point in Flintshire, Derek Brockway's latest walk starts off at the site of the Point of Ayr Colliery at the mouth of the Dee estuary. There, Derek meets John Wiltshire, who is passionate about keeping the memory of the mine alive. Derek lends a hand, helping endangered species in the sand dunes, and little terns who nest on the beach just over the Denbighshire border. Around 10 miles on, in 'Sunny Rhyl', Derek learns to kitesurf and do the surfers' shaka

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman check out the food and festivities on offer at Belfast's Mela Festival, from Korean kimchi and Jamaican patties. Baker Briony-May Williams finds out why Cumbria is the home of sticky toffee pudding, farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles in Carmarthenshire, and farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Sam and Shauna's Big Cook Out
programme.desc: Barbecue chefs Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn travel around Wales to create huge outdoor feasts to reward the work of a variety of organisations and individuals. They begin by celebrating football club Barry Town United's promotion to the Welsh Premier League, including cooking a whole pig, Hawaiian-style, in a huge brick fire pit, to be served with pit beans, cornbread and an apple and fennel slaw, with fruit-filled toffee apples for dessert

programme.title: Sam and Shauna's Big Cook Out
programme.desc: Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn celebrate the achievements of Clwyd Special Riding School in North Wales with a big cook-out. With more than 100 people to feed, Sam and Shauna organise a menu of 10 huge beef briskets, barbecued in giant cinder-block smoker, built with the help of the community

programme.title: The First Great Train Robbery (1978)
programme.desc: An accomplished gentleman crook and a master safecracker hatch a plan to rob a British Army payroll train carrying a fortune in gold bullion, destined for the troops fighting in the Crimea. British period thriller, based on director Michael Crichton's own novel, starring Sean Connery, Donald Sutherland, Lesley-Anne Down, Alan Webb, Michael Elphick and Wayne Sleep

programme.title: Figure Skating
programme.desc: Katherine Downes presents action from Saitama, Japan, where ice dance duo Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson were hoping to win Britain's first World Championship medal for 39 years. With analysis from Robin Cousins

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers head to Scotland for their next challenge, making-over a hotel room at a five-star golf and spa resort with just two days and a budget of £2,000. Half of the competitors are given a brief for a maximalist design for the hotel's more outdoorsy guests, while the others must create a tranquil space for those looking for a relaxing spa visit. With a double elimination looming, the designers pull out all the tricks they have up their sleeves to impress Alan, Michelle and guest judge Matthew Williamson

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Axon value items brought to Althorp House in Northamptonshire, where Christina is drawn to a 1950s toy pedal car and Will finds a Mouseman tray. Plus, Paul Martin discovers that the Grand Union was the canal equivalent of the M1

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti travel to Madeira, famous for its year-round spring-like weather, to work in one of Europe's greatest hotels, Reid's Palace. Giles irons bedspreads in a suite once loved by Winston Churchill, and Monica cleans crabs out of the historic tidal swimming pool

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: The captain of HMS Queen Elizabeth deliberately seeks out the worst possible weather so he can test how the F35 jets cope under extreme conditions - and gets his wish when the aircraft carrier ends up in the path of a hurricane. After consulting with his officers, he resolves to brave the elements and test the jets to the brink of destruction. The crew also faces the challenge of refueling the vessel at sea - one of the hardest tasks outside of going into battle

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: After spending the early 2000s perched on the high horse of respectability politics, Bill Cosby falls from grace with two trials, a conviction, incarceration, appeal - and in 2021 - an overturned verdict. W Kamau Bell asks what this means for people's attitudes to his previous work and the larger systemic problems Cosby's story lays bare

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz the theme of animals that begin with the letter T, with guests Hannah Waddingham, Desiree Burch and Jason Manford joining regular Alan Davies

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha conclude their investigation into how their own and other families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They are joined by a woman who wants to find out why, when she was a child, her aunts left Egypt for the new state of Israel, and a woman who wants to know what happened to her family as her grandfather struggled to hold on to his land and orange groves in Jaffa

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Staffordshire, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Newcastle-under-Lyme to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: The Mormons Are Coming
programme.desc: Following three young missionaries through training, as they give up their names and become Elders and Sisters who live under a strict time table with limited contact with family, will any of them go the distance? This documentary brings a unique insight into who the Mormons are from young believers who are passionate about their faith

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: JB Gill explores the landscape of Dartmoor. Starting his journey in the shadow of the famous prison, JB encounters a beautiful stone church built by prisoners from the Napoleonic Wars and takes to a quad bike to herd sheep and Dartmoor ponies for a local farmer. Journeying out onto the moor itself, he learns how the expansive areas of peat bog need to be preserved in order to maintain the country's environment

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple from Miami move to Cheshire and takes the opportunity to visit a factory specialising in hand-printed luxury garments

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway starts a walk in the pretty seaside town of Saundersfoot in Pembrokeshire, currently under-going a multi-million pound seafront regeneration. His nine-mile trek takes him through an area rich in mining history as he heads towards Pendine Sands in neighbouring Carmarthenshire. Derek discovers some fascinating military history as the coast was used as the site for rehearsals for the D-Day landings. The walk leads on to Pendine, with its famous seven-mile stretch of beach famously used for land-speed record attempts

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers unearth hundreds of years of fascinating history hidden in Britain's public houses, beginning in Yorkshire. They visit an establishment believed to have been drunk dry by troops the night before the Battle of Marston Moor during the English Civil War, while in York they learn about a pub that once doubled up as a hospital and has a gruesome history.

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup hosts this spin-off of The Big Painting Challenge, which sees six famous faces pick up a paintbrush to put their art skills to the test. The hopefuls are actress Jane Seymour, cricketer-turned-broadcaster Phil Tufnell, model and DJ Amber Le Bon, presenter Josie D'Arby, designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and singer George Shelley. First up they tackle the human form, which involves self-portraits and capturing a nude Keith Allen on canvas

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team visit Dorset, where they help rare-breed farmers Liam and Hannah to create a B&B and kitchen for a shepherd's hut

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore unique homes in India, including a house built in the highlands outside of Mumbai, and another within the mountainous scenery of the Western Ghats. Elsewhere, the pair also visit a riverside bolthole drawing on Indian architectural heritage, before ending with a unusual building named 'Collage House'

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antique experts James Lewis and Catherine Southon search for items to take off to auction at Dover Castle in Kent. James unearths a silver owl inkwell and Catherine discovers an alabaster bust. Presenter Paul Martin delves into the history of the English Channel

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman visit the National Ploughing Championships in Derbyshire on a food adventure, where they discover the story behind the Bakewell tart and are let loose on tractors. Farmer Meinir Howells reveals the secrets of one of the UK's oldest ice-cream parlours, Ryan Hand finds out the superpowers of seeds, and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenter and actress Mel Giedroyc, comedian Sophie Duker, chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and actor Nigel Havers, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Weyward by Emilia Hart, and Death and the Penguin by Andrey Kurkov

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton begins this episode at Loch Glashan above Loch Fyne, where Paul travels back in time to learn how to paddle a coracle. At Old Castle Lachlan, he dabbles in Victorian virtual reality, courtesy of George Washington Wilson and his stereoscopic camera, before visiting the open-air museum of Auchindrain

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the third semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the PDC World Darts Championship, the history of transportation to Australia, Parks and Recreation, and Queen Anne, before facing the general knowledge round

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Phase two of the quarter-final stage begins, with two teams who won their first match returning to play again, looking for the second victory that will secure them a place in the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is national finals week, where the winners from the regional heats compete to earn a place on the menu of the banquet celebrating animation and illustration for Paddington Bear's 65th birthday. Today, the eight regional champions cook their vegan starter courses in a bid to secure the first place at the event, with the panel of judges joined by comedian and actor Kulvinder Ghir

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Terry is expecting a big turnout for the DMDC's annual rally, but it remains to be seen whether the day will bring heartache or triumph for Andy and Lance

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Don't Look Now (1973)
programme.desc: A couple trying to get over the death of their daughter take a trip to Venice, where they are shocked by a psychic's claim that the child is trying to contact them. Although the wife believes her story, the husband remains sceptical - until he begins to be troubled by spectral visions of his own. Nicholas Roeg's supernatural thriller based on Daphne du Maurier's short story, with Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An Olympic athlete hopes for a podium finish for her figure skating clothing brand, and a vacuum attachment to combat dust from drilling aims to suck in the cash of Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, a coffee company couple hope they won't be on the receiving end of a roasting for their pitch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: JB Gill searches for hidden gems amongst Edinburgh's more familiar tourist sites, and discovers why one of the city's most important religious figures was buried in a car park

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Oswestry in Shropshire, and challenges fair-goers to guess the purpose of a food-related mystery item. With experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph appeals on behalf of Marie Curie, a charity providing care and support to people with a terminal illness, their families and anyone dealing with death and bereavement

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the sixth round of fixtures, including Castleford Tigers v Warrington Wolves and Leeds Rhinos v Catalans Dragons

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Short
programme.desc: The food enthusiasts cook traditional pasties at Geevor Tin Mine in Cornwall, then head northwards to Melton Mowbray, where they try their hand at making pork pies. The duo's trip ends on the banks of the River Deveron in Scotland, where they cook salmon coulibiac - a whole fish stuffed with prawns wrapped in filo pastry - for Highland dancers and pipers

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup presents the second round, which sees Jane Seymour, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Phil Tufnell, Amber Le Bon, Josie D'Arby and George Shelley tackle landscapes. However, for their first task they have to put down their paint brushes and dabble in the digital world instead, a medium not all the VIPs are comfortable with using. They are soon back on more familiar ground as they paint a cityscape of London, with comic Russell Kane popping by to help judge the results

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and the team are in Devon to help Faith create a unique B&B with a celestial theme as a tribute to her late father

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Norway to discover four extraordinary homes in a country where architecture is influenced by incredible landscapes and the extreme climate. Properties include Vega Cottage, on Vega Island, 600km north of Oslo near the Arctic Circle, a truly remote family retreat delicately perched on rocks and overlooking the beach

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, and Paul Martin learns about Lord Lothian's key role in getting America involved in the Second World War

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman takes Colin Murray on a food adventure in her home town of Anstruther. As well as its famous fish and chips, they discover how artisan bread is being made for the community. Briony May Williams bags bargains hunting for yellow stickers in the supermarket, Suzie Lee reveals how Greek-style yoghurt is made in Co Down and Onkar Singh Purewal discovers Swansea's community garden produce

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Jacqueline and her husband Alex were about to remodel their two-bed London terrace, but tragically, Alex fell ill and died. Three years since his death, Jacqueline has resolved to finish what they started, supported by her 22-year-old son Jamie. Jacqueline and Jamie share the family home, but both long for some privacy. However, the problem is that the terrace has just one reception room on the ground floor. Jacqueline and Jamie are handing over control to competing architects Lizzie Fraher and Julian McIntosh. Lizzie has plenty of experience in unlocking the possibilities in residential projects, while Julian loves the creative challenge inherent in modest budgets. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their fish courses to win a place on the menu of a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Guest judging is animator and co-founder of Aardman Animations, Peter Lord OBE, who joins the panel of food critics - Michelin-starred chef Tom Kerridge, restaurateur Nisha Katona and food podcast host and comedian Ed Gamble - as they choose the banquet's fish course

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Darren Harriott hosts the show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing stand-up performances by Jessica Fostekew and Stephen Bailey

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Jane Corbin travels to Taiwan to take viewers inside a story that has ramifications for all of us. In the process, she reveals China's 'playbook' as its desire to 'reunify the motherland' becomes ever clearer, and it could drag the world into a dangerous confrontation

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenter and actress Mel Giedroyc, comedian Sophie Duker, chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and actor Nigel Havers, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Weyward by Emilia Hart, and Death and the Penguin by Andrey Kurkov

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by rail through Queensland from Kuranda to Townsville, marvelling at the engineering expertise of a railway line built in the 1890s. He also visits a plantation where he learns how to harvest sugar cane and ventures into the hinterland, where he braves a crocodile safari

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the double booking nightmare that put a real dampener on the holidays of two families. Plus, the driver whose whose car was left damaged by an airport meet-and-greet service

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr transform the courtyard into a Mediterranean oasis. To brush up on their botany, the pair visit the magnificent gardens of one of Sicily's biggest wine producers, where they help out with the grape harvest. Keen to create an authentic Sicilian design, Alan explores Sciacca's famous ceramic scene and gets arty painting Moor Heads. He also enlists the help of two baroque-style painters to bring a touch of the island's rich history with a surprise courtyard centrepiece. Amanda repairs the old courtyard walls, which turns out to be a far bigger job than anticipated

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Author and architect Francesco da Mosto presents a guide to his native Italy. He starts in the North, where he views Leonardo's Last Supper in Milan and explores one of the world's oldest universities. He also visits Florence, the birthplace of Renaissance art, and Verona, the setting for Romeo and Juliet, before going underwater to see the statue of Christ off the coast of Portofino

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: A look at the career of Daniel Barenboim through his regular presence on the BBC including performances with his first wife Jacqueline du Pré, intimate chamber music, solo recitals, masterclasses and epic orchestral concerts

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Antiques Roadshow's Paul Atterbury recalls the heyday of the great ocean liners, travelling round Britain to reveal a story of design, politics and tragedy as he finds out how these great ships captured the public's imagination. Along the way he uncovers a cinema in Scotland built from the interiors of the SS Homeric, and visits a house in Poole, Dorset, where cabins from the Mauretania have been preserved

programme.title: The Secret Life of Books
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring classic works of fiction, continuing with TV script writer Tony Jordan examining Charles Dickens' popular novel Great Expectations. He investigates why the author changed the ending of the book, and asks what this tells the reader about the writer. Plus, the original texts and manuscripts are examined, which offer clues about the novelist's troubled life, and may have influenced whether Pip would have a future with Estella in the story

programme.title: Loyle Carner at 6 Music Festival 2023
programme.desc: Loyle Carner introduces his 6 Music Festival performance at Victoria Warehouse, Manchester, showcasing his music in a new way, and performing in collaboration with AMC Gospel Choir

programme.title: Christine & the Queens at 6 Music Festival 2023
programme.desc: From Victoria Warehouse, Manchester

programme.title: Arlo Parks at 6 Music Festival 2023
programme.desc: Arlo Parks introduces her 6 Music Festival performance at Victoria Warehouse, Manchester, featuring the world premiere of her new music

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Shanghai
programme.desc: In a programme filmed in May 1989, Clive set out to find out about a city that was once known as the Paris of the East and discovered China on the brink of revolution. As demonstrating students joined three million cyclists to clog the streets, he encounters a once-wealthy socialite who survived the Cultural Revolution, a baby-washing entrepreneur, a local eel-gutter and a jazz band playing Jingle Bells on an empty ferry cruising up the Huangpu River

programme.title: Sold! Inside the World's Biggest Auction House
programme.desc: The second of a two-part documentary going behind the scenes at Christie's, where Global President Jussi Pylkkanen and his team continue with their big push into Asia. As the company prepares for its sale to celebrate its 250th anniversary, an umbrella stand turns out to be worth millions and a Rubens appears that has not been seen in public for 150 years

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: The art critic examines some of the art world's biggest enigmas, beginning with Van Gogh's Self-Portrait with Bandaged Ear, asking why the painter cut off his ear

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Michael Palin looks back on the making of Pole to Pole, in which he travelled along a single line of longitude across the USSR, Africa and finally into Antarctica. Along the way, he paid a visit to Chernobyl and gained an insight into the last days of the Soviet Union. His travels across Africa led to an encounter with some fellow globetrotters from his home town of Sheffield - but he was forced to make a detour when his planned route passed through a war zone

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey through 1930s Britain from Canterbury to Skegness reaches Witham in Essex, where he visits the factory of the world's oldest supplier of metal-framed windows, which became popular in the Thirties. Crossing into Suffolk, he alights at Ipswich and discovers the story of a group of child refugees whose history is intertwined with that of Michael's family

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.desc: Artist Lachlan Goudie visits Glasgow's Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum to explore a collection that he has loved since he was a boy, and which shaped his ambition to become a painter. He examines the artistic processes underpinning the extraordinary paintings, such as Rembrandt's Man in Armour, Salvador Dali's Christ of St John of the Cross and Van Gogh's portrait of Alexander Reid, and reveals the power of the collection to enlighten history and change the way people view the world

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts seeks out the most outstanding archaeological digs of the year, beginning in the east of England. She witnesses the uncovering of a Roman mosaic found on farmland in Rutland, and visits the site of a saintly hermit's hovel discovered in the Lincolnshire fens

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Art experts Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit Haddo House in Aberdeenshire, which may be the home to some of Scotland's greatest lost paintings. They also head to the storerooms of Montrose Museum, where a portrait of Richard Mead purported to be a copy may actually be the original

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: Rupert Murdoch's involvement in the 2016 US elections and the Brexit referendum, which saw the media mogul rising in prominence after a series of scandals and setbacks, from the death of his mother and the collapse of his second marriage to the loss of several important political allies. The programme examines the resolution of the question of Murdoch's successor and a final multi-billion dollar deal that surprises everyone

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History
programme.desc: Sam Willis charts the impact of gunpowder on the battlefield, from cannons to the first hand-held weapons, and finds out what it is like to fire an English Civil War musket

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones sets about restoring the 200-year-old Trehilyn Farm in north Pembrokeshire. In this first edition, the comedian plans the project, in which he will replace the roof tiles with individually carved Welsh slates, and apply a white lime render to the stone walls

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts seeks out the most outstanding archaeological digs of the year, beginning in the east of England. She witnesses the uncovering of a Roman mosaic found on farmland in Rutland, and visits the site of a saintly hermit's hovel discovered in the Lincolnshire fens

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey through eastern England takes him to the Snape Maltings music and arts venue, the Norfolk seaside resort of Great Yarmouth and the city of Norwich

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming battles his way through blanket weed on the Shropshire Union Canal, before accidentally flooding a staircase lock in Chester

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel finishes his book and submits it to Alistair - who decides it needs a picture of the author on the cover. Unfortunately, choosing a suitable image proves troublesome. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Helen finds out about Maxine, but takes the whole thing in her stride. Conclusion of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama continues his narrative with a look at why Britain proved immune to the ideals of the French Revolution, ignoring the call of liberty, equality and fraternity so readily embraced by the peasantry of France. Instead, the influence of poets, painters and journalists of the Romantic movement persuaded the nation of the primacy of feeling over reason, and divided opinion on the civil strife across the Channel

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The scientific story behind the moment the first stars appeared in the universe, known as the Cosmic Dawn, which transformed the dark world originally created by the Big Bang. Astronomers now have the tools to explore this dramatic event that created the first ingredients of life as we know it, when the first stars were born to light up the universe. With contributions by Professor Tom Abel, Professor Volker Bromm, Charmaine Green and Margaret Whitehurst

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: Documentary series about nature's resilience, and how ecosystems devastated by human impact can be revived and become sustainable for future generations

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Nature intervenes as comedian Griff Rhys Jones continues in his attempts to restore his 200-year-old farmhouse in Pembrokeshire

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer Zoe Laughlin examines the toothbrush, an item so ubiquitous that most people do not give it a moment's thought - and yet 200 million of them are thrown away each year. Zoe sets out to create a sustainable solution, heading to a low-impact factory in Sweden where handles are made from sugarcane bio-based plastic and exploring bespoke production techniques employing 3D laser sintering

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: Running a marathon is hard. At least it is for a human. But what if we could swap our legs with an animal – would that make it any easier?First, we try on a pair of kangaroo legs. Rather than jump from one leg to the other, kangaroos keep their legs together and store the energy from each bounce in special ligaments that act like springs. They recycle the energy so that the kangaroo can travel long distances with very little effort. This efficient style of locomotion helps them get around the Australian bush, where it can be a long way between places with food and water. However, they get tired after around 30km and so a 42km marathon would be too much for them.So what about the longer legs of a T. rex? They have a stride length of around 4 metres compared to 1 metre for a human. And they can travel up to 50km. However, scientists believe that T. rex was too heavy to be able to run – if they tried they’d probably break their legs. So maybe we’re stuck with our human legs. But don’t

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain
programme.desc: Cam, Tyler and Aaron venture out and about to meet the wildlife heroes making a difference with some of Britain’s threatened woodland animals. In the Scottish Highlands, Cam helps a conservation project working to protect and increase numbers of the rare red squirrel. To help him search for one of our smallest and most misunderstood mammals, Cam must team up with a ‘bat detective’ to discover some of the latest technology being used to monitor the common pipistrelle bat. Meanwhile, Tyler steps back in time as he heads to the outskirts of Bristol to meet some surprising woodland predators that once called Britain home. Who would have thought brown bears and wolves are wandering these woods today? Back at OZT HQ, the brothers wow the audience with the tawny owl, and Aaron puts everyone to the test with a game of Fact or Fake. programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: On the face of it, humans are a bit breakable. We have these hard skeletons that can crack if you have a tumble. But if we were indestructible, like a superhero, then we’d never have to worry about ending up in plaster! So what’s the best way? First we try removing the problem – it’s our bones that break, so let’s get rid of them altogether. Unfortunately, this doesn’t work very well. Without our bones we’d basically be blobs and unable to move anywhere. Okay, metal is tough right? How about taking inspiration from knights in armour, and making our skin solid metal? The problem with metal is that if you hit it hard enough it will actually bend. So, your metal skin would soon be covered with dents and you’d end up completely bent out of shape. What we need is something that can take the knocks without changing shape permanently. What we need is something like rubber, something ‘elastic.’ Elastic materials deform when you hit or stretch them but then they spring back to their original sh

Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

Her fellow new recruits Annie and Tommy deal with an apprehensive colleague and undercover agents at work in the city, while their superior officer finds himself being threatened by MI5. Starring Sian Brooke

When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examine the double murder of two men from Blaenavon who were brutally murdered in 1972 that has remained unsolved for over 50 years. Following last orders at The Rifleman's Arms, the two men made the short walk home, but in a seemingly unprovoked attack, both were bludgeoned to death with a coal pick

programme.title: Match of the Day Wales

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include a medal given to one of the first men to land on D-Day, a dress by Swinging Sixties fashion designer Ossie Clark, and one of the first vials of penicillin. Fiona also meets the son of a Chinese immigrant and ship worker to discuss the history of the Chinese community in Liverpool

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Steven Knight's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an orphan pursuing his desire for a greater lot in life. His life is changed forever first by an encounter with an escaped convict, and then again when he is summoned to the household of wealthy recluse Miss Havisham (Olivia Colman), who intends him to be the companion of her adopted daughter

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Including highlights of Manchester City v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Manchester United v West Ham United and Everton v Liverpool

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben steps in last minute to impress Phil at the grand opening of the Boxing Den and Lola gets a call from the hospital. Linda frets as she waits for Janine's plea and Rocky worries that his past will catch up with him as he and Kathy meet the Vicar to discuss their upcoming nuptials

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Millions of council houses were built after the war to help protect people from slum landlords. They used to be home to around a third of the UK population. Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the River Annan in Dumfries and Galloway, following it from where it rises above the Devil's Beef Tub, all the way to the Solway Firth. On the way he samples some dubious-smelling 'healthy' spa water, discovers the explosive devil's porridge, before following in the footsteps of Robert Burns by taking a dunk in the briny close to where the river meets the sea

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Drama following three new recruits to Belfast's police force. Probationer Grace tries to help a fellow single mother whose son has fallen in with a notorious gang. However, fulfilling her promise could put her at risk from both sides of the law. Her fellow new recruits Annie and Tommy deal with an apprehensive colleague and undercover agents at work in the city, while their superior officer finds himself being threatened by MI5. Starring Sian Brooke

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: Ten of the UK's most promising unsigned artists head to Manchester to attempt to convince global singer-songwriter Jason Derulo, music manager Frank Harris and Brit Award winner Becky Hill that they have everything it takes to cut through in today's music industry. Host Jordan North captures all the backstage drama as the contenders vie for a life-changing record deal

programme.desc: Ben steps in last minute to impress Phil at the grand opening of the Boxing Den and Lola gets a call from the hospital. Linda frets as she waits for Janine's plea and Rocky worries that his past will catch up with him as he and Kathy meet the Vicar to discuss their upcoming nuptials

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Millions of council houses were built after the war to help protect people from slum landlords. They used to be home to around a third of the UK population. Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Working with ethical hackers to hack into the fraudsters' illegal call centres, Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor the scammers' phone calls in an effort to stop victims losing out to real-time scams. The programme also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods, such as bike theft, fly-tipping and romance scams, and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head-on

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Drama following three new recruits to Belfast's police force. Probationer Grace tries to help a fellow single mother whose son has fallen in with a notorious gang. However, fulfilling her promise could put her at risk from both sides of the law. Her fellow new recruits Annie and Tommy deal with an apprehensive colleague and undercover agents at work in the city, while their superior officer finds himself being threatened by MI5. Starring Sian Brooke

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Prime Ministers of Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Professor Alvin Jackson explores the lives of the six men who held the post of Prime Minister of Northern Ireland from the birth of the state in 1921 to the fall of the Stormont administration in 1972, and examines the key moments and critical decisions that defined these men's time in office . In the first episode, Alvin examines why James Craig introduced extreme security measures in 1922, and how John Andrews legacy was damaged by the bombing of Belfast by Hitler's Luftwaffe

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: Ten of the UK's most promising unsigned artists head to Manchester to attempt to convince global singer-songwriter Jason Derulo, music manager Frank Harris and Brit Award winner Becky Hill that they have everything it takes to cut through in today's music industry. Host Jordan North captures all the backstage drama as the contenders vie for a life-changing record deal

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Ex-Geordie Shore reality star Charlotte Crosby showcases her home town of Sunderland, life with her family and partner Jake and her extraordinary social life. She also outlines the progress of her growing business empire but when she receives some life changing news, how will she respond?

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The finalists take on their last challenge to win a £250,000 investment, with contestants ejected earlier in the series returning to aid them in their endeavours. The last two must launch their business, create a new brand for their company, produce a digital billboard, direct and edit a television advertisement and design a metaverse, before pitching to Lord Sugar and industry experts at a black-tie event

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen meets the 2023 winner and runner-up, and is joined by special guests - including Lord Sugar via videolink - to look back over the past 12 weeks of the business-based reality show

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Police find the names of an international drug network in a hotel guest book plus thieves who stole £20,000 worth of food are caught out by a car number plate

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It's a worrying time when one of the pygmy goats goes into labour unexpectedly. Ben Fogle helps the keepers sex their young pancake tortoises

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a semi-detached house just outside Dudley in the West Midlands and a mid-terrace in Burton-upon-Trent that has suffered some fire damage. Dion Dublin is in Bury, Greater Manchester, to see a house that needs a good clear-out

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and David Harper help two teams scour Edinburgh's Royal Highland Centre to pick up items to sell at auction, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp hears about an ice-cream van that's been doing the rounds since 1936

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Luca and Suni try to iron things out. Ollie tries to help his dad but Rich has an unwanted request. Emma has to placate an irate mother when she finds out her daughter wants a baby

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea make clothes rails out of timber and copper piping, while archive clips include Danny Clarke reshaping a garden by carving out eyecatching flower beds

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a buyer with a budget of £450,000 escape her ex-council flat in south London so her and her daughter can start a new life in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson tour Wales, picking up a rare toby jug and some art deco items. They also learn about an ancient fishing tradition and a Welsh Olympic legend

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Ben, Theo, Tobias and Niamh try to find the right path across the bridge in the hope of winning some cash. Game show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia gives Rocky an ultimatum, either he tells Kathy his secret by the end of the day, or she will. Lola is determined to plan a successful fundraiser and Keanu declares his love for a conflicted Sharon. Sam and Alfie drown their sorrows over their failed love lives at The Vic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Prime Ministers of Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Alvin Jackson delves into Basil Brooke and Terence O'Neill's terms in as Prime Minister including how Brooke dealt with the IRA's border campaign in the 1950's. Plus, how O'Neill's attempts to deliver reforms demanded by the Civil Rights movement were challenged from within the Ulster Unionist party and the rise of Ian Paisley

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: After an emotional scan, Charlotte announces her pregnancy to the world and her best friend Lauren is called in to help with a grand plan to take over York Fashion Week. Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: Witness History
programme.desc: Witness History's Farhana Haider is at the People's History Museum in Manchester looking back at five extraordinary campaigns and protest movements headed by women, including the South Asian women workers who led a strike against poor working conditions in a British factory. We also speak to one of the women fighting for the equal right to pray at the Western Wall in Jerusalem. We meet the forensic anthropologist in Argentina who founded a team dedicated to digging for evidence of crimes against humanity. In Canada, we speak to one of the Mohawk activists who spent months in a stand-off with the country's military over plans to develop a golf course on sacred burial ground. Plus, how an anti-war march turned into a peace camp that endured for nearly 20 years outside an American air base in rural England.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Carmen Roberts visits Siargao Island in the Philippines, two years after the surfer's paradise was devastated by Typhoon Odette, to find out how it's bouncing back. On her journey, she visits one of the few places in the world that's home to the stingless jellyfish.

programme.desc: Line of Duty co-stars and lifelong friends Neil Morrissey and Adrian Dunbar embark on a journey across UK and Ireland to explore their family histories. Neil was taken into care when he was just 10 years old, and feels utterly disconnected from his family history. Desperate to fill in the gaps, he has enlisted Adrian to support him on what they both know will be a deeply emotional journey. In Castlecomer in southern Ireland, Neil reconnects with his cousin Marilyn. A performer like himself, she is finally able to give him the family folklore he craves. Meanwhile, a DNA test reveals some shocking news for Adrian, before he hears about the heart-breaking struggles his grandmother faced

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.title: Mr Magoo
