However, it becomes clear that Lloyd's bitten off more than he can chew...

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Line of Duty co-stars and lifelong friends Neil Morrissey and Adrian Dunbar embark on a journey across UK and Ireland to explore their family histories. Neil was taken into care when he was just 10 years old, and feels utterly disconnected from his family history. Desperate to fill in the gaps, he has enlisted Adrian to support him on what they both know will be a deeply emotional journey. In Castlecomer in southern Ireland, Neil reconnects with his cousin Marilyn. A performer like himself, she is finally able to give him the family folklore he craves. Meanwhile, a DNA test reveals some shocking news for Adrian, before he hears about the heart-breaking struggles his grandmother faced

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.desc: The residents celebrate Christmas 1919 with a lavish party, but tensions are rife and Bates's arrest casts a shadow over the festivities. Mary has to consider her future with Sir Richard Carlisle following a disagreement at a shoot and Violet has concerns about Rosamund, whose new suitor - the dashing but raffish Lord Hepworth - is not all he seems. One-off festive special of the hit costume drama, guest starring Nigel Havers and Sharon Small, with Brendan Coyle, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen, Maggie Smith and Samantha Bond

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Oscar-winning actress Shirley MacLaine joins the cast of the period drama as Cora's mother Martha, who makes a grand entrance when she arrives at Downton for Matthew and Mary's wedding. However, with the couple struggling to stay united as their big day looms, will Martha's Atlantic crossing have been for nothing? Meanwhile, Mr Carson runs the rule over new footman Alfred, and Robert receives news that could leave him facing the greatest crisis of his life - and plunge the rest of the household into chaos. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estate's future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violet's help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and O'Brien's efforts to boost Alfred's progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Edith's big day finally arrives, but will her enthusiasm convince the family that Strallan's age doesn't matter? Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes anxiously awaits her results, Anna makes a breakthrough to help Bates, and Mary takes matters into her own hands to secure the estate's future - but the personal cost could be high. Costume drama, starring Laura Carmichael, Robert Bathurst, Phyllis Logan, Joanne Froggatt and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Branson's political views land him in trouble and Sybil's loyalty is tested to the limit, while Ethel makes a difficult decision about her son's future. Costume drama, starring Allen Leech, Jessica Brown Findlay, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt, Brendan Coyle and Jim Carter

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institution's evasive psychiatric professor. A second student's demise then leads to the revelation that the trial's participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more people to reunite with long-lost relatives. Claire Martin was abandoned in Hong Kong as a baby more than 50 years ago and heads back there to appeal for information about her origins, but with the help of DNA she finds family much closer to home. The team helps Nicki Goscomb and her sisters search for their brother, who was given up for adoption in 1966

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Unseen Adventures
programme.desc: The actress introduces more previously unaired footage from her travelogue programmes, this time focusing on her journeys to India and Uzbekistan. Joanna shares some previously unseen moments and provides viewers with an insight into the making of the series. In this episode, she travels the length of India, including footage of her encounters with the flower-sellers of Madurai, before taking us back to Uzbekistan, where she reveals some gory tales of the country's history and discovers the secrets of gem-making

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver makes a fish pie using potato skins as a crispy topping, and invites one of his old students to share ideas on low-cost cooking inspired by his family heritage. Jamies also prepares a one-pan chicken and fluffy rice dish, creamy cauliflower cheese spaghetti, and smoky minestrone soup, using odds and ends of pasta and vegetables

programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc: The journey continues, and alliances are starting to form within the group. With the gruelling trek starting to take its toll on the 12 Brits' bodies and morale, the temptations are becoming a lot harder to resist, as each enticing offering gets placed quite literally in their path. Will the thought of a hot shower be too hard to resist?

programme.title: Rise and Fall

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Trainee nurse Melissa has size MM breasts and wants to lighten the load, while personal trainer Leah would love leaner legs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery, or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?

programme.title: All the Sins
programme.desc: The opening episode of the third series of the Finnish crime drama. Lauri and Sanna reluctantly return to the strict religious community for another murder investigation. The town's former county constable has been found dead in a forest with a message pinned to his chest requesting that they head the case. In Finnish

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Berkshire, beauty therapist Emma and her boyfriend Sean kick off the week with an night of acronyms, pet names and fine food. On day two, the experienced partnership of Jasbir and Sarb attempt to wow their guests with a night of authentic Indian food and Bollywood dancing. Finally, Mel and Tony host with a menu filled with traditional British classics in a bid to win the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a couple who took on the task of constructing a sustainable two-storey timber house in the Kent countryside, heated by glass panels. Mimi da Costa managed the project despite a lack of experience, while her husband Andre worked and looked after the children, intending to have it completed in 16 weeks. But as the complex build threatened to drag on for months, it became unclear whether their home would succeed in blending into the landscape and provide them with a greener, healthier lifestyle

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes with UK Sotheby's International Realty, with the coronavirus pandemic having seen a surge of super-rich buyers leaving towns and cities. The brokers set out to sell a property in Highgate, north London, that is on the market for £40 million, as well the home of former Liverpool FC CEO Peter Moore on the Wirral

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: Tim and Emily fell in love with their 16th-century, Grade II-listed Cotswold cottage on first viewing, despite an abundance of dark beams, low ceilings and woodchip. For George, the project is his oldest house yet. And In Kent he tackles an oast house. Can he design a super cool bedroom for eight-year-old Bella in this unusual tower?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting to help one family and one pair of first-time buyers navigate the Bristol market. Kirstie's poker-loving couple, Liz and Ben, want to buy in their beloved Clifton where they have been renting. Meanwhile, Phil's searching for Greg and Joanna, who want to find a property in a family-friendly area within walking distance of daughter Oliwia's new school

programme.desc: Bear Grylls ventures into Ukraine by invitation of President Zelenskyy where he meets civilians who are trying to endure and survive the war to learn what life is like for them. On his way to meet the President in Kyiv, he visits the old front line in Irpin where he meets soldier Oleksandr who joined the army to fight the Russian invasion and journalist Alina who lost her father to the war

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer, James and Ed make a daring move with a six-course tasting menu at a Michelin guide restaurant while Nik and Eva escape on a tandem bike

Now three years later, Annalisa has a new partner and an enviable homestead, and Ben learns of the extraordinary journey the trio took during the pandemic and how they sustain their thrifty life with such passion and ambition

programme.title: The Murder of Meredith Kercher
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of British student Meredith Kercher in Italy in 2007 and the ongoing investigation to try and uncover the truth about her killer. Immediately after her death, Meredith's flatmate Amanda Knox and her boyfriend Raffaele Sollecito were charged with her murder, but after eight years of investigation and court battles, the pair were finally acquitted. Now, the question still remains, who killed Meredith?

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Between 1975 and 1980, serial killer Peter Sutcliffe - known in the press as the Yorkshire Ripper - murdered 13 women and attacked at least seven more in the north of England. In this programme, psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personality of Sutcliffe and look at events in his childhood and adult life that may have triggered his descent into murder, and also examine how he managed to avoid suspicion despite being interviewed by police numerous times

programme.title: Inside Windsor Castle
programme.desc: A look back at the series of events that shaped the monarchy between 1936 and 1952, using dramatic reconstructions and an extraordinary archive of film. Edward VIII's abdication in 1936 meant that his brother 'Bertie' became King George VI, and his eldest daughter Elizabeth was now suddenly and unexpectedly heir to the throne. When the Second World War broke out, Elizabeth and her sister Margaret moved into the safe haven that was Windsor Castle, which Elizabeth loved for its history and its heritage, while for Margaret it was one big adventure playground

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to the owner of a three-bedroom Victorian house in north London's highly desirable Camden area. programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son (2011)
programme.desc: FBI agent Malcolm dons his old lady disguise for a third time as he goes undercover to investigate a murder in a girls' school. His teenage son, who witnessed the crime, is forced to join him on the case, assuming a female identity of his own to enrol as a student. Comedy, with Martin Lawrence and Brandon T Jackson

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008)
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Deadpool (2016)
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin

programme.title: Glass (2019)
programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a mental hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalan's fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Una (2016)
programme.desc: A young woman arrives unexpectedly at an older man's workplace looking for the truth behind the affair that occurred between them. Drama, starring Rooney Mara, Ben Mendelsohn and Riz Ahmed

programme.title: Sign2Win
programme.desc: Deaf game show. Three teams' BSL language and deaf cultural knowledge are put to the test to see who will win £1,000

programme.title: Decision at Sundown (1957)
programme.desc: A gunslinger rides into a backwoods town intent on finding his dead wife's former lover and exacting revenge for her death. The man he blames now has total control of the town and has the sheriff at his beck and call. Undeterred, the drifter offers his enemy an ultimatum - he has until sundown to leave the town or face retribution for his crimes. Western, with Randolph Scott, John Carroll and Andrew Duggan

programme.title: Cat Ballou (1965)
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her family's land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: The Long Ships (1963)
programme.desc: A Viking warrior steals a ship and leads his crew in search of a legendary bell, rumoured to be three times the size of a man and made of solid gold. But they have reckoned without the ambition of the king of the Moors, who captures the Vikings and intends to use them to find the prize for himself. Adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Rosanna Schiaffino, Russ Tamblyn and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Daddy's Home (2015)
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: F. (2010)
programme.desc: An alcoholic teacher is left unable to cope after a violent incident involving a pupil. He is forced to regain his confidence when a gang of violent teenagers invade the school and brutally murder one of his colleagues, leaving him fighting for his own life and that of his daughter. Horror, with David Schofield, Eliza Bennett and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: A Cure for Wellness (2016)

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Bugles in the Afternoon (1952)
programme.desc: A disgraced cavalryman tries to redeem himself by returning to active service at a fort in the middle of Sioux territory, unaware the commanding officer is an arch-enemy from the past. Antagonism grows as they both fall for the same woman, and the newcomer finds himself assigned to ever more dangerous missions by his commander, who hopes he will fail to return from them. Western, with Ray Milland, Helena Carter and Hugh Marlowe

programme.title: Cowboy (1958)
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk befriends a visiting cowboy and soon talks his way into joining him on a cattle drive so he can impress the woman he loves. The tenderfoot has no idea of what awaits him as he ventures out into the Wild West, an experience that forces him to undergo a dramatic change. Western, starring Jack Lemmon, Glenn Ford, Anna Kashfi and Brian Donlevy

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)

However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.desc: A wealthy woman's privileged existence is shattered when she discovers her husband is having an affair with her best friend. Seeking solace, she turns to her estranged sister, who lives in a London council estate, and finds a new lease of life in joining her community dance class. Comedy, starring Imelda Staunton, Celia Imrie, Timothy Spall and Joanna Lumley

programme.desc: Four teenagers play a jungle-themed game on an old console, only to find themselves transported into the game and transformed into its heroic characters. They must embark on a death-defying journey through the game's wilderness setting to make it back to the real world, or be stuck as video game characters forever. Fantasy action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

Reassembling his team of sidekicks, he swiftly rises from the network's graveyard to become its biggest star with a run of ludicrously sensationalist broadcasts. Comedy sequel, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd and Steve Carell

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes concerned that his comfortable lifestyle is having an impact on his professional progress and is stopping him from achieving scientific greatness, so he asks the gang to make life more difficult for him. Comedy, guest starring Kyra Sedgwick and Nick Cannon

programme.desc: In this art deco special, George takes on a challenging period property in Newquay, owned by Gareth and Frances Jenkins. The building was once an architectural gem, but over the years has been the victim of unsympathetic modernisations, making it unrecognisable from its 1930s heyday. The challenge is to strip away the ugly accretions to reveal the house in all its glory - while also making it suitable for modern family living. Plus, George visits a stunning seaside home and Britain's biggest collection of neon signs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Royle Farm in Staffordshire, where mother and son Margaret and Fraser Mountford hope their farmhouse with a difference will capture the guests' imaginations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with three house-hunters with two very different needs, but one shared goal. In 2018, schoolteacher Katy, her comedian husband Charlie, baby daughter Lola, and pet pooch Harper were on the hunt for their first family home in Brighton. Having moved in with Katy's mum to save for a deposit, they had not only grown used to home comforts, but also the vibrant village atmosphere of pricey Fiveways - an area where their property dreams didn't match their budget. With Phil's help they widened the net, viewing four fantastic finds in and around Brighton. Two years later, Phil's back to see whether life on the coast has been plain sailing. And in 2019, Kirstie was scouring east London with 'granny on the go' Janet. Having been diagnosed with a degenerative back condition, Janet was desperate to ditch her lift-less, third storey flat in exchange for a ground-floor forever home. The tricky east London property market was proving tough to navigate though, and Kirstie soon f

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer returns to Brixworth in Northamptonshire to catch up with Sarah and Ian who appeared on the show back in 2015. Back then, they had just one toddler and two dogs and their two-bed semi was bursting at the seams. Ian wanted to move on, but Sarah was determined to stay, convinced their home had the potential to cater for a growing family. Now, Phil returns to find out what happened next

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Cumbrian couple Rob and Ruth, who have bought a 200-year-old former blacking mill and plan to slot in an entirely new, timber-clad structure within its walls, giving the impression that it is peeping out from the original ruins. But the original building is a scheduled monument and Historic England inform them it is too dangerous to repair, giving them no choice but to painstakingly rebuild the ancient mill around their new structure

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan is joined by Neil Gaiman in the Isle of Skye and the Scottish Highlands, who reveals how the Isle is steeped in myths and legends and is a source of inspiration to him. Jonathan visits Dunscaith Castle, home to one of Skye's legendary warrior queens, before travelling across the island to find out about Skye's fairyfolk, reputed to be able to magically bestow musical ability

programme.title: Race to the Death: Rome's Charioteers
programme.desc: Documentary exploring new discoveries about chariot racing in ancient Rome, exploring how influential the sport was in Roman culture. While charioteers are still among some of the best-paid sports stars in history, the stakes were particularly high, with riots provoked by the results of races and curses employed to influence the outcome. The documentary follows a team attempting to reconstruct a racing chariot and take it round a test track, and uncovers the story of the slave who became Rome's most successful driver

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 43-year-old cyclist is brought to A&E after crashing face first into a car, with injuries are so severe that he was put into an induced coma at the scene. Meanwhile, 68-year-old Pat awaits the results of an X-ray after injuring her leg on holiday, and 89-year-old Adrian complains of chest pain

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: In Coventry, crewmates Mark Rattray and Orlaigh Barbour attend a 73-year-old woman who is in agony after falling on the ice. Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy are sent to a baby who has been fitting. On the other side of the city, Neil Vann and Laura Perkins have to deal with a well-known drunk nuisance caller

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty sets out to learn how kippers are produced, and finds out why this nutritious smoked fish is no longer a breakfast favourite. Matt Tebbutt and Helen Lawal try to discover why rice cakes are white when they are made of brown rice

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Amber and Colin turn their bedroom into a dream vintage haven. After an initial assessment, the presenter begins by getting rid of any mass-produced furniture

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Vicky O'Grady and Simon Stevenson are both passionate about Spain and their greyhounds. Vicky has retired and Simon wants to live and work abroad, so they're ready to make their dream life in the sun a reality, near Alicante. Jasmine Harman helps them find a new home in Alicante on their budget of £70,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Featuring a couple in France taking their painting holiday business in a new direction, a bike hire shop in Spain, and a Somerset fitness instructor recovering from a setback

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien finds a barn containing a collection of replica Rolls-Royce cars, and Henry Cole tries his hand at driving a tractor as they continue their money-making tour

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien arrive in York, where Henry struggles to squeeze into some motorcycle leathers and Simon gets into deep water when he tries to restore an aluminium boat

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers discover the tragic life story of former soldier Arthur Jones, who left an estate worth £225,000. Plus, a nationwide search gets under way for the relatives of David Johnson, who are set to receive an inheritance of £37,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at N'ista Boutique Room in Birkdale, Merseyside, but owners Ian and Sally Lawless's chances of winning suffer a setback when strange green goo is found in the bathroom

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the second visit, the B&Bers head to Oakleigh Guest House in Blackpool, where breakfast and a trip to Madame Tussauds prove a hit - but there is still some harsh feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues as Linda Milner and her friend Lany welcome their guests to Bay House in Scarborough for a socially distanced stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Farrier in Cayton, North Yorkshire is the week's final destination, run by mother-and-daughter duo Suzie and Dani Bushby. The luxurious rooms go down very well with their guests, before the B&Bers enjoy a day meeting Dani's horses at the family's manor home. During dinner the contestants shed a tear as they reflect fondly on the competition. However, just as Suzie and Dani think they're on the home straight, some issues arise at bedtime for Mark and Sean

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners reunite to settle some scores. Mark and Sean are keen to find out why one pair of guests wouldn't stay at their Oakleigh Guest House again, while Linda and Lany are annoyed about some nitpicking feedback about the flowers in their rooms at Bay House in Scarborough. Later, the payments and winner are revealed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in north London and Hertfordshire. In London, Kirstie helps first time buyers Emily and Dustin who are desperate get on the property ladder after spending a year living with Emily's parents as they save up for a deposit. Meanwhile in Hertfordshire, Phil tries to find home for three generations of females moving out of London

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a couple in Poole, Dorset, who cannot agree whether to sell their four-bedroom chalet bungalow or renovate instead. Supply teacher Sue has waited 35 years for builder husband Roy to finish their renovation and would rather they move so they can enjoy their retirement. But he loves the space their house offers and doesn't think it can be replicated elsewhere

Their ambitious plan was to build a metal-sculptural home inspired by aircraft hangars right next to the runway, but the difficulties of building their elegant design saw a year-long project stretch to three years

programme.title: Home Greek Home

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has been stabbed in the leg and the head, only to discover he had already overdosed on heroin prior to receiving his injuries. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How in devising the F35 Lightnin II, engineers have pushed the boundaries of aviation technology further than ever before and created a brand new, revolutionary, fighter aircraft capable of handling threats in the air and on the ground. Plus, Rob Collings flies one of the most successful aircraft of the Second World War, the distinctive P38, former RAF test pilot Andy Edgell tracks down the product of a top secret research project, the X-14 and retired US Air Force pilot Mace Carpenter reconnects with the stealthy F117

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: New York Architect Wendy Fok travels to the remote Guizhou Valley in China to see the Beipanjiang First Bridge, the highest bridge on Earth, which boasts a 20,000 tonne steel deck. She soon discovers that trying to straddle a 565 metre gorge so deep that it's known as the 'crack in the Earth', presented huge challenges for its engineers. Plus, Andrew Steele tracks down a bridge on the thames that nobody thought could ever be built, Suzie Sheehy is in Hampshire climbing the tallest unreinforced concrete town ever built and Luke Bisby scales the Forth Bridge in Edinburgh

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In East Yorkshire, Michael Portillo goes bird-watching on the cliffs of Flamborough Head before travelling to Filey in North Yorkshire, where he learns to decipher traditional knitting patterns. He then continues his journey to the Victorian seaside resort of Scarborough, and views a 4,000-year-old skeleton called Gristhorpe Man

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the first leg of his second journey, Michael Portillo heads to Kirkcaldy in Fife, finding out along the way how the mill town of Preston in Lancashire gave birth to the Temperance Movement. In Blackpool, he enjoys a performance in the Tower Ballroom and discovers the railways had a direct impact on the town's birth as a resort. After a stroll along the pier with local comedian Joey Blower, Michael visits Morecambe Bay

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Preston to Kirkcaldy, returning to the historic Settle-Carlisle line he helped save from dereliction when he was Minister of State for Transport in the 1980s. Here, engineer Tony Feshini describes what life was like for the people who originally built Ribblehead Viaduct, before Michael visits Dent, Cumbria, home to the highest railway station in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey following George Bradshaw's footsteps, as the third leg of his trip from Preston to Kirkcaldy sees him embarking on a two-day tour of the Lake District. He begins in Windermere, where he travels by steamboat to the north of the lake, and continues to Claife viewing station, where he learns about the water pollution caused by increasing levels of tourism. He spends the night in Grasmere, and the following day reaches Kendal, where he buys local delicacies and meets a farmer who explains the impact of railways on farming practices

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Carlisle, where he meets a descendant of the Border Reivers, a group of ancient lawless clansmen mentioned in Victorian train enthusiast George Bradshaw's book. From there, he travels to Gretna Green to learn about the village's famous marriage trade, explores an old Ministry of Defence munitions site, and visits the centre of Glasgow, which is enjoying a revival in popularity

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Glasgow and travels to Carluke in Lanarkshire's Clyde Valley, where he meets Tom Clelland, who is trying to revive his family's fruit-growing business. On his way to Edinburgh, he learns about the vast range of items left on trains, before spending the night in the city's famous Balmoral Hotel. His journey ends in Kirkcaldy, where he explores the paintings donated to the local gallery by his grandfather John Blyth

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels along Brunel's Great Western Railway, learning how mass tourism started in Swindon, before visiting Bath to discover the history of the famous spa baths. His last stop is Bristol, where he tries his hand at blowing blue glass

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Swindon to Penzance. Starting in Yatton, he travels along a line that was once used to transport fresh strawberries across the country, but was closed by Dr Beeching in the 1960s. He also visits the Gough Cave in Cheddar Gorge to view the remains of the 9,000-year-old Cheddar Man - the oldest complete skeleton in Britain

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Spin-off series that follows the journey of a vehicle being repaired, restored and re-auctioned. A sun-bleached red Vauxhall Astra GTE gives the team a headache

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics

programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook, Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they have left behind. He begins in Manchester, where he finds out how the world's first industrialised city produced a revolutionary political movement, and learns about the railway workers who founded one of the most successful football clubs of all time. Along the way, the presenter does the washing in Port Sunlight - a model village on the Wirral - and hears stories about the aptly named George Francis Train's time in Birkenhead, Merseyside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers micro-mines hidden in the Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire, and finds out why the Victorians were so enamoured with Tintern Abbey in the Wye Valley along the border between England and Wales. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joanna's journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperor's favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Adam Holt hosts the fourth dinner party in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where his fellow competitors' expectations are high. However, some of them are surprised by his menu - which fails to amount to much more than sausages and mashed potato

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Raconteur Russell Turnbull hosts the final night in Eastbourne, East Sussex. Having played his cards close to his chest all week with regards to his culinary skills, his plans for a fancy menu intrigue his rivals. However, for all the bravado, it remains to be seen whether he can actually cook

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Berkshire charity worker Lynda Feymor has travelled all over the world, but it's Portugal's eastern Algarve that's captured her heart. With a budget of £175,000, Jasmine Harman scours every nook and cranny of the local market to find five properties, but can any of them give Lynda the 'feeling' she is searching for?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Creative Brighton couple Emily and Peter Harold have been holidaying on the Spanish island of Majorca for 14 years, and are determined to buy a second home there. They're looking for somewhere to relax and soak up the sun and culture on offer in their favourite spot of Port de Soller. Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments for their £250,000 budge

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Pub landlady Alison seeks a home on the Costa Dorada in Spain. Famous for its golden beaches, the region has stunning river valleys and traditional hilltop villages, where Alison would love to buy a smallholding and keep chickens. With five options up his sleeve, Jonnie Irwin helps Alison and her friend Theresa, who's come along for support, find the perfect property for her £70,000 budget

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding welcome AJ Odudu, Gemma Collins, Jessica Hynes and Tim Key to the tent for the second of this year's star-studded special editions for the charity campaign. They must make Signature sandwich cakes, a Stand Up To Cancer-themed classic tart for the Technical, and in the showstopper they relive their earliest childhood memories in choux

programme.title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines (2003)
programme.desc: John Connor finds his destiny to lead the human race in a future war is catching up with him when an advanced new Terminator in female form is sent back in time to eliminate him. However, a reprogrammed cyborg has also been dispatched to act as his protector. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Nick Stahl, Claire Danes and Kristanna Loken

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer, James and Ed make a daring move with a six-course tasting menu at a Michelin guide restaurant while Nik and Eva escape on a tandem bike

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A London Underground worker undergoes tests to look for signs of a heart attack after collapsing at a Tube station, and recalls the difficulties he faced in his childhood. Doctors work to stabilise the chest and back injuries sustained by a man who fell in his garden, and a Royal Navy veteran comes to A&E with an infected splinter in his arm

programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness challenges a group of 12 strangers to make a gruelling trek across 18 miles of the South African wilderness - and resist a series of temptations along the way. The party starts out with a prize fund of £300,000 to be shared at the end of the journey, but each time one of them cracks, the money goes down

Unfortunately, the show's visit coincides with the busiest day of the year for coach parties and it's a race against the clock to get the crew out before the first bus load arrives

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Catching up with tenants and landlords from previous episodes, including a man living in a damp and mouldy flat, who was unable to sleep in the bedroom due to the horrendous conditions. The programme also revisits a 70-year-old landlady whose tenants stopped paying the rent for a year, and the council's Rogue Landlord Team in Lewisham, who learned where a slum property owner's reputation for a short fuse came from

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kellie owes five months' rent, but refuses to leave unless the bailiffs arrive, while Simon wanted to sell his house post-breakup, but the tenants are still there five years later, and Arvydas is happily living in his garden shed

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A landlord seeks urgent advice from eviction specialist Chris after finding his three-bedroom terrace has been stripped bare of the fittings, the flooring, and even the grass on the lawn. Landlady Rose gets a shock when she finally gains access to her property, and Dave from Peterborough Council's housing team comes across some of the worst damp and mould he has ever seen. Plus, Selina and Lee must return from America for a court case to recover £10,000 rent arrears on their UK property

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kate faces trouble from unruly tenants, who became anti-social, and are now trying to sue her for serving them an eviction notice. Dhiren relates how the existing tenant of a house he bought stopped paying rent as soon as he took ownership, and Tim explains how a health scare left him seeking to sell his property - but a standing occupant refused to leave

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Claire and Simon seek eviction specialist Chris's help to evict a man claiming to be renting their old family home. Meanwhile, Hamza hopes to get his council flat back after he tried to help a neighbour's friend by letting them stay for a week, but ended up being shut out when they refused to leave. Plus, a man is almost £30,000 in debt and in danger of repossession after his tenants stopped paying the rent

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire officers are called out to a massive crash near a theme park that has resulted in the death of at least one person. The need to understand what has happened and who - if anyone - is to blame tests the resources of all the traffic cops who attend and then investigate this fatal incident. Will their gut instincts that this is a drug-fuelled disaster prove correct?

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents an edition focusing on the hunt for disqualified, unlicensed and uninsured drivers. In Bradford, officers from the West Yorkshire Safer Roads team pursue a desperate and disqualified driver through the city streets, while a member of the public is forced into making a citizen's arrest when another banned motorist attempts to flee the scene of a crash. In York, a pensioner is knocked down in a hit-and-run incident and an urgent search for the culprit gets under way

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire is considered a soft touch by criminals, who using the county's rural back roads to operate under cover of darkness. In this edition, the team's elite officers hunt down and arrest burglars, drug dealers and thieves. Jamie Theakston narrates

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers have to deal with the consequences of cars hitting cyclists and pedestrians. In York, traffic cops need all their professionalism to deal with a distressing situation when a pregnant bike rider is knocked off her bike by a lorry, while a pedestrian in Leeds has been hit by a driver who appears to have used their car as a weapon. But does CCTV footage show the whole story? Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team carries out a raid that turns up a stash of drugs, a weapon and a large pile of cash, while Jon Peacock is amazed to encounter a half-naked man covered in blood on the wintry streets of Lincoln, but the real surprise comes when the officer finds out what he has been up to. Suspicious driving leads Jim Woolerton to discover super-strength lager and drugs, and a speeding motorist comes out with a very middle-class excuse after being clocked travelling at 110mph

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The dog unit embarks on a desperate manhunt amid fears that an armed and dangerous character is roaming the streets of Lincoln, while Craggy closes in on a suspected shoplifter with a bag full of surprises. Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit also tackle a would-be stunt rider and a boozed-up biker who is raising hell on the A-roads

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A case of drink-driving leads to a hot pursuit on the city streets and carnage on the country roads, while a routine stop for speeding gives a lone female officer a worrying surprise. programme.title: Evil Up Close: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: The case of Mathew Hardman, dubbed the 'vampire killer', who thought that by taking a life he would become immortal. He stabbed an elderly neighbour to death, removed her heart and drank her blood

When Maxine organises for herself and Ian to do a live television interview, she risks her own alibi when someone she met in Grimsby on the night of the girls' disappearance sees her on TV. Fact-based drama, starring Jemma Carlton and Scott Reid

programme.title: Swipe, Match, Murder: The Murder of Grace Millane

The story of how the killer of the British backpacker was brought to justice after she was murdered by Jesse Kempson in New Zealand in December 2018 after they arranged a date on Tinder. programme.desc: An ambitious senatorial candidate murders his campaign manager for threatening to expose his secret affair. To avoid suspicion, the politician makes the killing look as if he was the intended target of an assassination attempt that went wrong - but ends up having to pit his wits against the slovenly sleuth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Jackie Cooper, Ken Swofford and Tisha Sterling

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A compulsive gambler with a mountain of debts comes up with a plan to make some easy money. He plants a bomb under his wealthy uncle's car in the hope of inheriting a large legacy - but a hit-and-run driver jeopardises the entire scheme and Columbo is soon sniffing around for clues. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Tyne Daly, Greg Evigan and Don S Davis

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A London theatre producer discovers his actress wife is having an affair with her co-star in their latest production. To avoid exposure, the pair murder him and make it look as if his death was an accident. Meanwhile, Columbo is in the city to pick up some tips from Scotland Yard, and sets about uncovering the truth. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Honor Blackman, Richard Basehart and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is discovered during a city-wide power cut - and because Jethro and the team are unable to use their modern electronic equipment, they have to solve the case the old-fashioned way, and it soon becomes apparent that national security could be at stake. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate a government organisation dedicated to child prodigies while researching the death of a marine whose body appeared in the middle of a field disguised as a scarecrow, and realise a 12-year-old could be the killer's next target. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A logbook is Logan's only lead when Arthur Kopinsky is found dead at his law firm. A closer look at the evidence suggests suspects in the form of a swindler who stole a woman's fortune, and the son of his target, who was once wealthy himself. Starring Chris Noth and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man who served as a juror in the trial of a mobster is shot dead at a baseball game, leading to a battle of wills between McCoy and his long-time friend - the suspect's attorney. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The body of a drug addict is discovered in the yard of a daycare centre, and evidence reveals she was the heiress to the fortune. However, suspicions are raised when the family's lawyer gets power of attorney over the trust fund. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of an undercover narcotics agent during a drugs raid splits Kincaid and McCoy over whether or not to ask for the newly reinstated death penalty. Ultimately, District Attorney Schiff must make the call. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jill Hennessy

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An investigation into three murders in the offices of a magazine places the detectives in the middle of a fierce family feud, involving a protective matriarch, warring siblings and a corrupt judge. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives respond to a hold-up committed by a bloodthirsty team of robbers in ski-masks, and McCoy struggles to determine whether the teenage tearaway found with the criminals was an unwilling hostage or a active participant in the crimes

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when fellow agent Lara Macy's body is found badly burnt in a campfire on Annapolis beach. According to her laptop she was tailing an unco-operative rape victim, and the prime suspect in the crime is the son of a DC contractor. Gibbs knew Macy years ago, and he finds he can no longer avoid his Mexican past catching up with him as the case progresses. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Dean captures Gibbs in Mexico and hands him over to Paloma Reynosa, head of a drug cartel and daughter of the man he killed. She tries to persuade him to aid her master plan by threatening to kill his father. Alejandro Rivera arrives with a platoon of Mexican troops, but hopes of rescue may be premature. Meanwhile, Ziva is accepted as a US citizen

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs's father is increasingly frustrated at being kept in his son's house under armed guard, and Franks joins his security detail after emerging from the convent where he had been hiding out. Meanwhile, Ducky finds evidence at a helicopter crash that gives the team an important lead in tracking down Paloma Reynosa, and the drug kingpin's brother Alejandro may have an ulterior motive when he tries to secure a deal involving her extradition. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander whose body suddenly explodes before Jimmy can examine it

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A girl is kidnapped by a sex offender in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, and efforts to find her are hampered by the interference of a pushy local journalist. She and her abductor are eventually located - but he dies of anthrax poisoning shortly afterwards, raising fears of a major outbreak

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An investigation into the near-fatal stabbing of a schoolboy leads the team to a female suspect who had been bullied by the victim because she was being raised by a gay couple. Her subsequent trial turns into a legal battle over the rights of same-sex parents - and leads to allegations that her guardian is guilty of abuse. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is sexually assaulted in a nightclub and her nine-month-old baby thrown from a car, triggering an investigation that leads Benson and Stabler to an elderly lady and her drug-dealing daughter-in-law. Digging deeper, they unravel a complicated story of addiction, abuse, desperation and robbery

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and the team investigate the discovery of a woman's severed head, following a trail of clues that leads to her boyfriend, who works as a butcher. At first his trade makes him seem a likely subject - but later developments suggest the involvement of a gang selling black-market body parts to people awaiting transplants

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: The task force mounts a rescue mission in Uzbekistan when an undercover CIA agent is kidnapped by a band of separatists led by a highly dangerous past associate of Red's. However, Keen and Ressler soon learn who they are up against when they too are taken hostage by a man with a strong political cause who insists they deliver a very important message

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Red targets a cult leader who finances his incestuous community by charging the world's elite criminals to store their contraband on his sprawling compound. Seizing the chance to catch a man usually well-protected by lawyers, Liz and Ressler assemble a task force to storm the area, but when they arrive, they find all but one of the members butchered inside the chapel

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

Guest starring Robert Wagner, with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An abortion clinic doctor is murdered, and when Logan and Briscoe investigate, they begin to suspect members of a radical movement led by a former priest, who appears to have no sympathy for the man's fate. Starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A wealthy Wall Street stockbroker's death looks like suicide, but Logan suspects otherwise and pins the blame on the man's protege. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: After a woman is killed during an attempt to shoot her husband, the team discover the couple were attending an infertility clinic where the doctor was involved in illegal practices. However, they find themselves unable to arrest him due to confidentiality rules, and his patients' reluctance to talk

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives respond to a hold-up committed by a bloodthirsty team of robbers in ski-masks, and McCoy struggles to determine whether the teenage tearaway found with the criminals was an unwilling hostage or a active participant in the crimes

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis try to solve the murder of a college student whose death was depicted in graphic detail on the internet. However, the investigation grinds to a halt when they encounter a lawyer who is unwilling to reveal vital information about her client's past

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Curtis helps a woman who claims her baby was kidnapped while she was at confession to retrace her steps. However, legal questions begin to appear when her attorney introduces a unique defence. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to locate a kidnapped girl but has to contend with her grandfather, a former member of a disbanded special forces unit. The agents discover he has been secretly negotiating with the kidnapper, who was once in his undercover team and has decided to kill off his old colleagues in a bid to atone for their actions. Meanwhile, Abby is forced to work with an intern, and makes him follow her idiosyncratic rules. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the home of a bomb disposal expert who shot and killed an intruder during a robbery. The case appears to be straightforward until Tony discovers she lied about being alone during the incident, and the evidence suggests a link to a case in which a man walked free after paralysing a member of the public in a shootout. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team becomes involved in an international incident when the body of an American petty officer is found by an estate agent in a bungalow that has been repossessed. An indentation on the victim's skull leads the agents to believe he was killed on a British ship, but collecting evidence from the vessel proves challenging. Guest starring Tracy Middendorf, Daniel Gillies and Kristen Ariza

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi asks the SVU for help with a murder investigation when one of the witnesses shows signs of abuse

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A youngster faces a heavy sentence after shooting dead the crooked businessman who murdered his mother - until his lawyer concocts a novel defence. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

What follows is a race to locate the pair before they fall victim to their unknown kidnapper's brutal plans. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: USA
programme.desc: Yellowstone is the oldest national park in the world, home to the world's highest concentration of geysers and thermal springs as well as herds of bison that roam the highlands

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six is accused of disrupting the ordered routine of the Village, and as punishment is subjected to a lobotomy experiment designed to determine if sound waves and drugs can alter a man's personality

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary meets opera singer Eugene Ginty and his miniature donkeys, and rat-breeder Laura Woods and her pets in Cork. Plus, staff at a canine creche celebrate a goldendoodle's birthday, and there's a look at the All-Ireland Cat Fancy Dress Competition in Dundalk

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits North Uist in the Outer Hebrides, where he goes scuba-diving to explore the underwater world of Loch nam Madadh, the largest saltwater feature of its kind on the island. Ray also admires the wildlife populating its shores, including diving and wading birds, sea eagles, red deer, otters and common seals

programme.title: Royals and Animals: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary relationship between the Windsor's and their animals

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Meanwhile, Dr Harrison suffers as his career, reputation and relationship all seem ruined, while Miss Galindo and Mr Carter grow closer as they face up to the tragedy of Hanbury. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Soho and Milllwall, with fascinating facts for locals and tourists alike. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: A Place of One's Own (1945)
programme.desc: An ageing couple move into a haunted house, where their companion becomes possessed by the spirit of a murdered girl. Ghost story, starring James Mason, Barbara Mullen, Margaret Lockwood, Dennis Price, Dulcie Gray and Michael Shepley

programme.title: Seance on a Wet Afternoon (1964)
programme.desc: A self-professed medium with a greed for money and publicity arranges the kidnap of a wealthy industrialist's daughter, with the intention of winning acclaim and the ransom when she locates the child using her alleged psychic powers. British psychological thriller, starring Kim Stanley, Richard Attenborough, Mark Eden, Nanette Newman, Gerald Sim and Judith Donner

programme.title: The Big Catch (1967)
programme.desc: A group of children tries to capture a wild horse with the aim of selling it to mend an old boat. Children's drama, starring David Gallacher and Ronald Sinclair

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The team revives humans from another planet who have been frozen for 300 years. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary follows Martin and Jennifer as they travel to rural Co Donegal for a five-star luxury break for both them and their dogs. Meanwhile, the budgies compete in the All-Ireland final, and there is the story of how a Great Dane bonded with a three-year-old girl who has epilepsy

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the South Downs, starting from Beachy Head, and examines some of the 39 species of butterfly recorded as using its chalk downlands as a habitat, including the Adonis blue. He also visits the supposedly haunted yew woodland at Kingley Vale nature reserve in West Sussex and comes across peregrine falcons and badgers

programme.title: The Grass Arena (1992)
programme.desc: Biopic of chess grandmaster and author John Healy. Raised by an abusive father in a heavily religious family, the young Healy turns to boxing to learn to defend himself. But as his sporting career falters, he finds himself struggling with alcoholism. Starring Mark Rylance and Pete Postlethwaite

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: My Left Foot (1989)
programme.desc: Biopic of Irish writer and artist Christy Brown, who had cerebral palsy leaving him unable to control most of his body. Born into a large, poor family, Christy is disregarded as a hopeless case by the medical establishment, but encouraged by his devoted mother as he learns to write and draw with his left foot. Starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis and Brenda Fricker

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: Part one. Logan becomes persistent in asking aliens questions about his father

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino and Fino go on an adventure with Zeena to learn about the flags of many African countries.

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Fino has a dilemma; she wants to join the football club but is told by the boys that girls don't play football, but Fino doesn't give up on her dream.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of Air France Flight 447, a scheduled passenger flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris which dramatically vanished over the Atlantic Ocean in June 2009

programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: Keith Floyd samples the traditional fare of Ulster, cooking beef in Guinness stout with oysters, and paying a visit to the Old Bushmills Distillery. He also takes part in the Taste of Ulster culinary contest, where he faces stiff competition in the form of Northern Ireland's best chefs, and learns the art of making potato bread at the Ulster Folk Museum

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Hsuan Tsang is named Tripitaka when he is selected to journey from China to India to find the Buddhist Holy Scriptures, with Monkey and a talking horse for company. Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume star

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: Life For Ruth (1962)
programme.desc: A doctor tries to have a man who refused to allow his dying daughter to be given a blood transfusion prosecuted for manslaughter. Drama, starring Patrick McGoohan and Michael Craig

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay
