programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering arranges to meet a stranger who has information about a valuable sword. Guest starring Edward Woodward

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Staff Nurse Rachel prepares to hand-rear two kittens for the next 12 weeks, hoping that by then an adoptive family will be found. New vet Aisling makes her first house call. An emergency call is made to the cat hospital after cat Jessie is hit by a truck

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Parody of 1970s cop shows, in which a detective struggling to solve the murder of a chef is forced to bring together four mismatched cops to crack the case

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours of Charlton, Greenwich, Plumstead. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: White Collar Boxing League
programme.desc: Fast-paced adrenaline-filled White Collar Boxing from The WBCL. Fighting talk, getting up close and personal to the competitors in and out of the ring

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.title: My Left Foot (1989)
programme.desc: Biopic of Irish writer and artist Christy Brown, who had cerebral palsy leaving him unable to control most of his body. Starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis and Brenda Fricker

programme.desc: Vilified as vermin by some and admired for pluckiness by others, the fox divides public opinion. State of the art tracking technology reveals how foxes exploit human environments

programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Argyll, where he prepares venison loin in blackcurrant liqueur and is shown how to pickle herrings, before leg of mutton with caper sauce is on the menu for the local laird. Later, Keith tries to catch a salmon for the man reputed to have been the inspiration behind Ian Fleming's James Bond character

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Families
programme.desc: Unique families from around the world who live their lives in a less than conventional way

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Park Row (1952)
programme.desc: An ambitious reporter in 19th-century New York sets up his own newspaper, but his former boss will go to any lengths to rid herself of the competition. Drama, starring Gene Evans, Mary Welch and Bela Kovacs

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering arranges to meet a stranger who has information about a valuable sword. Guest starring Edward Woodward

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham as lonely hearts looking for love. Undertaker William Shawcross joins a dating agency in the hope of finding his ideal match, and is instantly attracted to put-upon midwife Mary Gilcrest - but she is less than keen to go on a date as she has her hands full with a mother-to-be suffering from a terminal illness. After a lacklustre first meeting, Mary agrees to see William again and a spark ignites between the fledgling couple - only for tragedy to strike when her patient dies, and the undertaker is called in to remove the body, revealing his unappealing occupation in the process. With Dominick Baron, Ricci Mcleod, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six wakes to find himself back in London, but his delight is cut short by the realisation that his mind has been transported into the body of a scientist wanted by the Village authorities. Vintage drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: The Long Firm
programme.desc: Harry strikes up a friendship in prison with Lenny, a hippie Marxist lecturer who lands in hot water for teaching his theories on social deviance to the inmates of the maximum security wing. His course is shut down and Harry is moved to another jail, but the pair continue to communicate using a secret code to fox the authorities. Over the years, their relationship develops - until Lenny is horrified to read about a break-out at Brixton Prison

programme.title: Fascination (1979)
programme.desc: A thief seeks refuge in a grand castle, and is pleasantly surprised by the two beautiful women living there. However he soon realises his seductive hosts are addicted to drinking fresh human blood. French horror, starring Brigitte Lahaie, Franca Mai and Jean-Marie Lemaire

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: Robert Llewellyn presents as Suffolk builders the Cement Mixers and Dorset cabbies the Turbo Taxis battle to build snowmobiles from nothing but scrap in 10 hours. After completing their contraptions, the teams face a race against the clock on the world's only purpose-built indoor track

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: Robert Llewellyn hosts as vintage railway buffs the Steaming Scots compete against firemen the Extinguishers to build and race giant motorised skateboards. Their contraptions must be capable of carrying four adults and use weight transfer alone to negotiate a treacherous slalom course

programme.title: Scrapheap Challenge
programme.desc: Robert Llewellyn and Lisa Rogers oversee proceedings as police dog handlers Woof Justice face professional drivers the Bus Boys in a race to build mortars capable of firing miniature basketball ammunition. Not only must their contraptions be able to attack with pinpoint accuracy, they also need to be capable of moving across rough terrain while coming under a barrage of incoming fire

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: The show visits Cheltenham, where dealer Chris Chandler is excited to discover an erotic bronze by early 20th-century Viennese sculptor Franz Bergman, but David Dickinson encourages the owner to turn down his offer and put the piece up for auction

At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds.
